Relation.isPartOf: Stuart Z. Perkoff Papers (Collection 1573). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. $b Library Special Collections
Name.creator: Perkoff, Stuart Z.
Title: Stuart Z. Perkoff Papers, ca. 1952-1974
Summary: Perkoff was born in St. Louis, Missouri, in 1930; spent time in New York and then on the west coast before establishing himself in Venice, California; as one of the poets of the Beat era, Perkoff's books included: Suicide Room (1956), Eat the Earth (1971), Kowboy Pomes (1973), and Alphabet (1973); was arrested on a drug charge in 1968 and released from prison in 1971; after trying to establish a bookstore in Northern California, he returned to Venice in 1973; died of cancer in 1974.
Description.note: Stuart Z. Perkoff (1930-1973) was a Beat era poet living in Venice, California. The collection consists of his manuscripts and 46 handwritten journals.
